page.title: 05RECLAMATION-HOLKER MOSS
page.content: The Mosses area contains a great deal of low-lying,marshy land.Over the years some of it has been drained by digging a series of{drainage ditches which empty out into the estuary.Some of the drained land is now being used as rough grazing pasture for sheep and cattle. Much of the area is still in the process of being drained and is not yet fit for agricultural use.One area which is known as{Deanholme Moss}has been dissected by ditches at 50 to 100m. intervals.These ditches are about 1m. wide and 2m. deep.The land between them is of a peaty nature. Because the land is of such low gradient the peat takes a long time to drain. The drained areas which are not yet farmed are mostly covered by heath or conifers.
